radiographic_examinations.findings: Various malformations in the feet, hands, spine, and extremities; hallux valgus with extra ossification center in the distal end of the first metatarsal and marked hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx; shortening of the first metacarpal and proximal phalanx of the thumbs; enlarged posterior elements in the cervical spine.
Neither cartilaginous fusions of the posterior elements of the cervical vertebrae nor inflammatory processes in the posterior part of the neck were detected.

Monophalanx of the great toe, marked hallux valgus, deformity of the distal end of the first metatarsal, extremely short first metacarpals, and hypertrophied posterior elements of the cervical spine with fusions.
